alert.note: Alert for Marin; Napa; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 3:57PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rain band will start to move through Marin County and southeast portions of Sonoma County shortly and will persist through the evening, bringing the possibility for minor roadway flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Marin and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 745 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.3 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Petaluma, San Rafael, Novato, Mill Valley, San Anselmo, Larkspur, Sonoma, Corte Madera, Tiburon, Fairfax, Sausalito, San Geronimo, Lucas Valley-Marinwood, Point Reyes Station, Black Point-Green Point, Kentfield, Stinson Beach, Muir Beach, Tamalpais-Homestead and Tamalpais-Homestead Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
